main event: A witness in Holly, Michigan saw three unidentified objects in the sky on August 4, 1966.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be flashing lights and stopped at around 10-15 degrees above the horizon, then started 'saying something' at around 20-25 degrees above the horizon.
At one point, the object changed from pulsing lights to a flat yellow light the size of a star, then started pulsing again.
The object moved up and down and side to side, with the witness unable to get a good fix on what it looked like.

The witness sent a follow-up letter inquiring about the investigation, but the Air Force response indicated they were unable to identify the object and that similar sightings are typically destroyed after 30 days.
The witness drew a sketch showing a compass rose and instructions for indicating the object's position and movement.
sighted object: three unidentified flashing lights/objects in the sky
photographs: no photographs, only a hand-drawn sketch
